title: John Cullen (rugby union)
text:
John Cullen (born May 16, 1990 in <a href="La%20Mirada%2C%20California">La Mirada, California</a>) is an American <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> athlete who currently plays for <a href="Utah%20Warriors">Utah Warriors</a> in the <a href="Major%20League%20Rugby">MLR</a> and the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States national rugby union team</a> as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Lock">lock</a>. He was selected to tour with the <a href="USA%20Selects">USA Selects</a> for the 2013 and 2014 <a href="Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">Americas Rugby Championship</a>, and most recently for the <a href="2014%20end-of-year%20rugby%20union%20internationals">2014 End of Year Tour</a> of Europe. His debut with the Eagles was in November 2014 against <a href="Romania%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Romania</a>, and he earned his first starting cap against <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Tonga</a>. He was called in to train at the Summer 2014 High-Performance Camp with the Men's Eagles Sevens team.
Club.
Cullen initially played his club rugby with <a href="Seattle%20Saracens">Seattle Saracens</a>, winners of the <a href="British%20Columbia%20Rugby%20Union%23Okanagan%20Springs%20Brewery%20League%202014%E2%80%9315">Okanagan Spring Brewery League</a> as well as the inaugural Elite City Sevens Tournament. He was named to the All-Tournament Team for the 2014 Elite City Sevens Tournament and scored four tries in the <a href="2014%20World%20Club%207s">2014 World Club 7s</a> Tournament at <a href="Twickenham%20Stadium">Twickenham Stadium</a> as Seattle won the Shield.
College.
Cullen was a USA Rugby Collegiate All American at Utah and toured New Zealand with the 2013 Men's Collegiate All-Americans.
Before transitioning to rugby, Cullen was a second-team all-<a href="Pac-12%20Conference">Pac-12</a> conference left tackle who started 24 games in two seasons for <a href="Utah%20Utes%20football">Utah</a>.
